title: Mirror Brand (dNetHack)
data:
| )   Mirror Brand   *(No tile)*        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

|                                       |                                                                                                                                           |

| Damage vs. large                      | 1d8 **x2** + *(special)*                                                                                                                  |

| Bonus versus                          | - cross-aligned targets
  monsters that fail 
  [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)")
   check |
|                                       |                                                                                                                                           |

| Affiliation                           | * [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral")                                                                                                      |
|                                       |                                                                                                                                           |

| Weight                                | [48](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                                                                                               |
| Material                              | [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver")                                                                                                           |

**Mirror Brand** is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). It is [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral"), and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") made of [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver").

## Generation

Mirror Brand may be generated in one of the [minor spires](/wiki/Map_inclusion_\(dNethack\)#Minor_spire "Map inclusion (dNethack)") encountered in [the Outlands rings](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack_Outlands#Outlands_rings "User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack Outlands") of the [Neutral Quest](/wiki/Neutral_Quest_\(dNetHack\) "Neutral Quest (dNetHack)").

## Description

While wielded, Mirror Brand grants [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"). Versus non-neutral monsters, it has +1 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit"), deals double damage and can apply extra magical effects similar to those of [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane"), adding a +2d10 damage bonus if the effect occurs and the target monster fails a check versus their [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)").

## Encyclopedia entry

What does it mean to fight for the Balance? How is one a part  
of it, how does it make its way through all things?  
  
Balance is the quest for equilibrium, the movement of all  
things to the center. If the center cannot hold...that is the  
fear, that the Spire is the foundation that all others  
foolishly seek to crack and topple in their careless pursuit  
of malice and charity, freedom and constraint.  
  
Yes. But more -- what is the identity of Balance? Its face?  
Who is that face, and what is its identity?  
  
The identity of Balance is its citizens and its guardians.  
Its citizens are those who are neither too cruel nor too  
kind. Its guardians however must kill and save innocents,  
must be selfish and charitable in equal quantities. The face  
of Balance is the rilmani, the guardians. They are forever  
walking the line, ever seeking to keep themselves in  
equilibrium. Who they are is this walking, this act of  
treading upon the thinnest of strands.

\[ Blade of Innocence, by Sciborg ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Mirror_Brand_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit)*

Mirror Brand (dNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
)   Mirror Brand   (No tile)
Base item long sword
Damage vs. small 1d6 x2 + (special)
Damage vs. large 1d8 x2 + (special)
To-hit bonus +1
Bonus versus
  • cross-aligned targets
    • monsters that fail MR score check
Weapon skill long sword
Size one-handed
Affiliation
  • neutral
When carried

(none)

When wielded
  • reflection
When invoked

(none)

Base price 3000 zm
Weight 48
Material silver

Mirror Brand is an artifact weapon that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. It is neutral, and its base item is a long sword made of silver.

Generation

Mirror Brand may be generated in one of the minor spires encountered in the Outlands rings of the Neutral Quest.

Description

While wielded, Mirror Brand grants reflection. Versus non-neutral monsters, it has +1 to-hit, deals double damage and can apply extra magical effects similar to those of Magicbane, adding a +2d10 damage bonus if the effect occurs and the target monster fails a check versus their MR score.

Encyclopedia entry

What does it mean to fight for the Balance? How is one a part
of it, how does it make its way through all things?

Balance is the quest for equilibrium, the movement of all
things to the center. If the center cannot hold...that is the
fear, that the Spire is the foundation that all others
foolishly seek to crack and topple in their careless pursuit
of malice and charity, freedom and constraint.

Yes. But more -- what is the identity of Balance? Its face?
Who is that face, and what is its identity?

The identity of Balance is its citizens and its guardians.
Its citizens are those who are neither too cruel nor too
kind. Its guardians however must kill and save innocents,
must be selfish and charitable in equal quantities. The face
of Balance is the rilmani, the guardians. They are forever
walking the line, ever seeking to keep themselves in
equilibrium. Who they are is this walking, this act of
treading upon the thinnest of strands.

[ Blade of Innocence, by Sciborg ]
